H0.text: Organs are the next level of complexity formed from the grouping of tissues, where similar types of cells form tissues.

H1.text: Organelles are the next level of complexity formed from the grouping of tissues, following the fact that similar types of cells form tissues.

H2.text: Organisms are the next level of complexity formed by grouping tissues that arise from similar types of cells.

H3.text: Organ systems are the next level of complexity formed from the grouping of tissues, where similar types of cells form tissues.

A4.text: an organ is a collection of tissues joined in a structural unit to serve a common function

A5.text: When three or more organs are present, it is called an organ system
